intro: Pseudarthria hookeri var. hookeri, commonly known as the slender legume, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its small, pea-like flowers are usually pale blue to white, and it produces slender, hairy pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in grasslands and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate to subtropical climates.
